feed.title: SAP Community - API Management
feed.subtitle: API Management Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Do we have any standard APIs available in SAP PI (NWDS) to retrieve message logs
entry.content:
Hi All, I'm working on automating some monitoring/reporting tasks and was wondering if SAP PI (NWDS) provides any standard APIs to programmatically access message logs and retrieve a list of communication channels.

 

By using this below API I'm unable to retriew the Messages logs

https://<host>:<port>/mdt/messageoverviewqueryservlet?component=<component_name>&view=<view_type>&begin=<begin_datetime>&end=<end_datetime>&detailedStatus=true

entry.title: Need a step by step help create an API with APIM ,set Basic Authentication and OAuth v2 Policies
entry.content:
Hi,

I have iflow with endpoint (https://53535estr.trial.it-cpitrial06-rt.cfapps.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com/http/customerDataJMS),

I want to create an API using integration suite API management to secure with policies
1) Basic Authentication and
2) OAuth v2.

I want to create a custom user name :User1 and password: test123 and give to vendor to access the API and Can we do the same custom  user name and password for OAuth v2.
please help.

entry.title: Question about the parameters to use in the API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV/CreateUrlAsAttachment
entry.content:
Hello,

We are trying to generate an attached URL in the material document header object, using the standard API API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV with the CreateUrlAsAttachment entity. But, we are not able to get the API call to successfully generate the URL.

 The main limitation we found is identifying the correct parameters to include . Currently, we are making the  API call, but it returns a 400 error. Please,  find below the parameters we are using:

SemanticObject:''

BusinessObjectTypeName: 'BUS2017'

LinkedSAPObjectKey: '49000005022025'

Url:'https://www.google.com

UrlDescription: 'For

More Info'
MIMEType: 'text/url'
SAPObjectType: 'materialdocument'
HarmonizedDocumentType: 'SL1'

 

 
 
Something may be wrong with the businessobjectTypeName, and we are unsure whether the value we are using is correct. Additionally, we are uncertain about the values for LinkedSAPObjectKey and el SAPObjectType , as we have not been able to determine from the API documentation what should be passed in these parameters.
Thank you in advance

entry.title: Instance not showing up when doing a SAP mission
entry.content:
Hi

I am currently trying this SAP mission:

https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/protected/index.html#/missiondetail/3258/3327/?tab=projectboard

I am now in the part:

Design and test your first integration scenario

Part 2:

Expose Integration Flow Endpoint as API and Test the Flow

Under Part 3 Copy credentials from service key you should see a new instance here:

  1. In your SAP BTP subaccount, navigate to your service instance page. Choose Services > Instances and Subscriptions

All I can see is the Integration Suite under Subscriptions. The Instance part is blank.

Do you have an isea what is missing here or what I am doing wrong?

Thanks!

entry.title: Adding API Management to CPI
entry.content:
Our current instance of SAP CPI - is the sfsf edition and does not include API management. I was able to add Entity and Service assignments for API management using the consumption model with CPEA credits. 

However when i try to subscribe to the service, it fails to create the instance the errors are as below..

Service broker error: Service broker apimanagement-apiportal failed with: Service instance provision failed with error : The service instance creation failed as the API Management, API portal is not set up yet for tenant

Service broker error: Service broker apimanagement-devportal failed with: Provision failed with error : DevPortal Subscription is empty for subaccount ************* with : {}

I do not see any boosters for API management at the global level either. 

Can anyone help with this, i suspect its a licensing issue with the base Instance of CPI being SFSF edition, but would like a confirmation. 

Regards

Ravi Raman

entry.title: Implemented OAuth2 Policy in APIM Integration suite successfully, but Unable to Access the iflow.
entry.content:
I created a new api proxy for Oauth token (https://2we321f7trial-trial.integrationsuitetrial-apim.us10.hana.ondemand.com:443/2we321f7trial/newoauth/newtoken)  added a oAuth2 policy Named "GenerateOAuthToken" to Generate the token and other api proxy for an iflow (https://2we321f7trial-trial.integrationsuitetrial-apim.us10.hana.ondemand.com:443/2we321f7trial/ikramSendData) used oAuth2 policy named "VerifyOAuthAccessToken" to verify the token, I am able to generate the AccessToken from Postman using the oAuth2 Authorization, after that   payload will be sent to the IFLOW, but after Generating the  access Token and using it ,when I am sending the data it is  giving the error "401 Unauthorized"

Code for oAuth2 policy "GenerateOAuthToken" 

<OAuthV2 async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" XMLNS="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt"><Operation>GenerateAccessToken</Operation>

<GenerateResponse enabled="true"/>

    <SupportedGrantTypes>

           <GrantType>client_credentials</GrantType>

       </SupportedGrantTypes>

   <Tokens/>

</OAuthV2>

Code for oAuth2 policy "GenerateOAuthToken" 

<OAuthV2 async="false" continueOnError="false" enabled="true" XMLNS="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">

  <Operation>VerifyAccessToken</Operation>

   <GenerateResponse enabled="true"/><SupportedGrantTypes/>

<Tokens/>

</OAuthV2>

Please suggest remedy to solve 401 UnAuthorized, so that the integration IFLOW  is accessed and data is sent.

Thanks,

Arindam Sur

entry.title: 403 Forbidden Error on API-Proxy (BTP Integration Suite) to OnPremise-Webservice
entry.content:
Hello All,

I can’t find a solution to my problem.
My goal is to make a Webervice from an OnPremise-System available over BTP but i always get the generic HTTP error 403 Forbidden.

Basically, I have almost the same requirement as described here: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/create-api-provider-in-sap-integration-suite-for-sap-s-4hana/bc-p/14052913#M180019
A CloudConnector is already set up for the OnPremise-System and seems to be working correctly.

I’m using a Trial-BTP account.
I created an API Provider pointing to the OnPremise system, and built an API Proxy based on that provider.
In the API Provider, I also configured the Catalog Service to expose available OData services.

What works:

  • API proxies using normal URLs work fine.

  • The Cloud Connector can successfully connect to the OnPremise system.

  • The tunnel from Cloud Connector to BTP is working:

  • The configured Catalog Service in BTP Integration Suite also responds correctly:


I can see that requests from BTP do reach the OnPremise system.

Also the can "Discover" the existing ODATA-Webservices of the OnPremise when i create a new API-Proxy. Again a working request from BTP to OnPremise.

That’s why I believe the problem is somewhere in the request to the Trial-BTP itself or in the Trial-BTP configuration.

What I’ve tried:

  • I checked roles/role collections. I created a role collection with all available roles to ensure I have all necessary permissions.

  • I tested different backend services and protocols. I now test directly via the Catalog Service, since I know that one can be reached.

  • I tried the API Debugger, but the information shown doesn’t help me understand the issue.

Additional info:

  • I send test requests via Postman, using Basic Auth with my OnPremise login credentials.

  • I’m not using principal propagation on the OnPremise side or in the CloudConnector.

My Questions:

  • Does anyone see why I’m still getting a 403 Forbidden error?

  • Could this be caused by a limitation in the Trial-BTP that I’m not aware of?

  • Or maybe it’s something completely different?

I hope someone can help me out with this. Let me know if you need any other infos or screenshots.
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Issue Importing API Proxy After Adding Fault Rule in ProxyEndpoint
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I attempted to add a fault rule in the ProxyEndpoint of an API Proxy to handle error exceptions within the API. However, after downloading the API proxy, modifying it locally to include the fault rule, and re-importing it into SAP API Management, I encountered the following error:

The fault rule we have added is :

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<ProxyEndPoint default="true" xmlns="http://www.sap.com/apimgmt">
    <name>default</name>
    <base_path>/v1/erp/pricingsimulator/poc</base_path>
    <properties/>
    <routeRules>
        <routeRule>
            <name>default</name>
            <targetEndPointName>default</targetEndPointName>
            <sequence>1</sequence>
            <faultRules/>
        </routeRule>
    </routeRules>
    <faultRules>
        <faultRule>
            <name>NoAPIKeyError</name>
            <condition>(fault.name = "FailedToResolveAPIKey")</condition>
            <steps>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>NoAPIKeyError</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>1</sequence>
                </step>
            </steps>
        </faultRule>
        <faultRule>
            <name>InvalidAPIKeyError</name>
            <condition>(fault.name = "InvalidApiKey")</condition>
            <steps>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>InvalidAPIKeyError</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>1</sequence>
                </step>
            </steps>
        </faultRule>
        <faultRule>
            <name>BasicAuthMissing</name>
            <condition>(BasicAuthentication.decodeBasicCreds.failed = true)</condition>
            <steps>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>BasicAuthMissing</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>1</sequence>
                </step>
            </steps>
        </faultRule>
    </faultRules>
    <preFlow>
        <name>PreFlow</name>
        <request>
            <isRequest>true</isRequest>
            <steps>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>OAuth</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>1</sequence>
                </step>
            </steps>
        </request>
        <response>
            <isRequest>true</isRequest>
            <steps/>
        </response>
    </preFlow>
    <postFlow>
        <name>PostFlow</name>
        <request>
            <isRequest>true</isRequest>
            <steps/>
        </request>
        <response>
            <isRequest>true</isRequest>
            <steps>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>KVMO_GetCPIUrl</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>2</sequence>
                </step>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>logToElasticSearch</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>5</sequence>
                </step>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>generateLogMessage</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>3</sequence>
                </step>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>LoggingBasicAuth</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>4</sequence>
                </step>
                <step>
                    <policy_name>KVMO_CPICredentials</policy_name>
                    <condition> </condition>
                    <sequence>1</sequence>
                </step>
            </steps>
        </response>
    </postFlow>
    <conditionalFlows>
        <conditionalFlow>
            <name>DefaultFaultFlow</name>
            <request>
                <isRequest>true</isRequest>
                <steps>
                    <step>
                        <policy_name>defaultRaiseFaultPolicy</policy_name>
                        <condition> </condition>
                        <sequence>1</sequence>
                    </step>
                </steps>
            </request>
            <conditions>proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation" OR proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation/**" OR proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation(**"</conditions>
            <readOnly>false</readOnly>
            <sequence>1</sequence>
        </conditionalFlow>
        <conditionalFlow>
            <name>getsimulation</name>
            <conditions>(proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation" OR proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation/**" OR proxy.pathsuffix MatchesPath "/getsimulation(**")AND(request.verb = "POST")</conditions>
            <readOnly>false</readOnly>
            <sequence>0</sequence>
        </conditionalFlow>
    </conditionalFlows>
</ProxyEndPoint>

 

Queries : 

  1. What is the issue causing here ?
  2. File format we are using : Zip (Do we need to use 7-zip for this , we have compressed the file to zip file?)
  3. Does the folder name within the APIProxy during import should be in the same order as the download folder,  This is the order of the file we are importing in API.  

Could you please help me understand what might be causing this issue?

Thanks

 

Vaisu Raj

entry.title: Issue Adding or Removing Proxies from Product in SAP API Management – Screen Keeps Loading
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m facing an issue in SAP API Management and would appreciate your help or insights.

I’ve created several API Proxies for my SAP CPI system and also created a Product. When I try to assign proxies to the Product:

  • For some proxies, it works fine, and I’m able to add them successfully.

  • For other proxies, the screen keeps loading indefinitely and never completes the assignment process.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

✅ I recreated and redeployed the problematic proxies.
✅ I tested the proxies directly in the browser — they work fine when called.
✅ I tried performing the assignment in Incognito mode and in different browsers.
✅ I even tried removing previously assigned proxies, but the UI again keeps loading endlessly during the remove operation.

Despite all this, the issue persists. It seems like there might be an internal problem in API Management, possibly some stuck metadata or backend inconsistency, but I’m not certain.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue?

  • Is there any workaround to force-remove a proxy from a Product (e.g. via REST APIs)?

  • Is there a way to clean up potentially stuck objects in API Management?

  • Any logs or places to check for deeper troubleshooting?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your support.

#

entry.title: Issue Adding or Removing Proxies from Product in SAP API Management – Screen Keeps Loading
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m facing an issue in SAP API Management and would appreciate your help or insights.

I’ve created several API Proxies for my SAP CPI system and also created a Product. When I try to assign proxies to the Product:

  • For some proxies, it works fine, and I’m able to add them successfully.

  • For other proxies, the screen keeps loading indefinitely and never completes the assignment process.

Here’s what I’ve tried so far:

✅ I recreated and redeployed the problematic proxies.
✅ I tested the proxies directly in the browser — they work fine when called.
✅ I tried performing the assignment in Incognito mode and in different browsers.
✅ I even tried removing previously assigned proxies, but the UI again keeps loading endlessly during the remove operation.

Despite all this, the issue persists. It seems like there might be an internal problem in API Management, possibly some stuck metadata or backend inconsistency, but I’m not certain.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue?

  • Is there any workaround to force-remove a proxy from a Product (e.g. via REST APIs)?

  • Is there a way to clean up potentially stuck objects in API Management?

  • Any logs or places to check for deeper troubleshooting?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance for your support.

entry.title: any standard API to export invoice attachment from SAP system and send to external service provider
entry.content:
any standard API to export invoice attachment from SAP system and send to external service provider?

In concur system -

The VAT IT App is an “standard offering” by SAP Concur and VAT IT (= SAP Concur Partner) and this app is offered in the App Center within Concur T&E (CTE). This is what we have enabled in CTE for SAP Concur system.

As this VAT IT App/the API is used to connect to the CTE system/tenant (to read data of SAP’s employees from the CTE databases), we would like same functionality / this API to pull data from other SAP system (Non Concur system)?

entry.title: Extend standard API API_CONDITION_CONTRACT
entry.content:
Hello,

I m on Premise 2023 FPS00 and I want to use the standard API API_CONDITION_CONTRACT. Unfortunately no extensibility is supported as specified in the documentation. I need to add custom fields to the API . Ideally I would like also to add the standard structure WCOCOI which is not yet supported but it is a component of the condition contract. 

What is the recommendation to add the custom fields when no extensibility is available?

  • Copy the standard API and add the custom fields?
  • Enhance the standard CDS views and use implicit enhancement in the Behavior Implementation?
  • Create our own API 

@Andre_Fischer maybe you can help.

Thank you

Christophe

entry.title: SAP API PROXY principal propagation error 403
entry.content:
Greetings SAP community,

I have been trying to expose an ODATA service on our on-premsis ECC system through Integration Suite's API Proxy.

I configured all the nesscary steps between BTP and SCC, SCC and the back-end system so that the identity is forwarded to SCC and then to the back-end system by X.509.

I have confirmed that Principal Propagation works as i use it in a Destination Configuration with SAP Graph and it forwards the identity correctly, requests are executed sucessfully.

However when i try to send a request through API Proxy, i recieve an error 403. API Management isnt exactly clear on how the request should be sent to the proxy, whether it should contain a specific header or a token. I have tried to send the JWT recieved from the OAUTH server for an Integration Flow client in the Authorization Header, still getting the same 403 error.

The API provider created for the proxy uses Authentication type "Principal Propagation".

I would appreciate help in this matter.

entry.title: Control by Field Status Variant when executing Journal Entry - Post (Synchronous)
entry.content:
Dear All,

When I run Journal Entry - Post (Synchronous), does the control of  Field Status Variant per account work?
I tried it and it didn't work, so I would like to check.

Example:

When Cost Center is hidden, if you try to go to register Cost Center with the API, it will be registered.
Ideally, Cost Center would not be registered, but would be posted without error.

Best Regards,

Yuki Tsumura

entry.title: When will the materials API be released? it is now in BETA version
entry.content:
Hi,

My customer would like to use this API https://api.sap.com/api/SIA_Material/overview

to update material characteristics into S/4HANA Private Cloud.  More specifically this one: https://api.sap.com/api/SIA_Material/path/patch_CharacteristicValues__ID__

The API is still in BETA release. What are the plans to make this API public released?

Many thanks for your support! Kind regards, Goedele

Soma

entry.title: "Error Occured while plotting the chart" - Custom View in SAP APIM

we are getting an error while monitoring the custom view dashboard in SAP APIM.

2. What could be the cause/meaning of this error! 

We would like to monitor the error messages in the SAP APIM through dashboard where we stuck with this, a response would be a great support for us ! 

Thanks and Regards,

Vaisu Raj

entry.title: I can't create an API provider (cloud connector)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community.

When I try to create an API provider with Cloud connector option I give details about Management Host, Authentication Basic and use my GmailID and password of my sap trial account, it throws me this exception: System is up and reachable. However, the ping check responded with code: 401; Message: Unauthorized.

I have logged into my account with the same GmailID and password, and when i go to manage profile and try to change the password by giving my current password it throws an exception saying: Could not be verified. 

Note: The password works when I log into my trial account.

Any help is much appreciated.

entry.title: Developing with SAP Integration Suite - API Proxy Error
entry.content:
Hi,

 

I am currently working through the learning journey "Developing with SAP Integration Suite" but I am having issues when it comes to API policies. As per the training, I have created the API provider and API proxy and I am now applying policies to the API proxy. I have set up the "Assign Message" policy, named setCredentials, and the "Basic Authentication" policy named setBasicAuthentication. Within the setCredentials policy, I have assigned the username and password variables to my username and password used to log into the SAP GUI HTML Test system (Logon - https://sapes5.sapdevcenter.com/)

 

Within the training, when you go to resources within the the API to get the Product Set, it returns a code 200 server response.

However, for my API I am receiving a 401 error.

 

Is there something incorrect about my API setup that might cause this error? From the body response, it points to incorrect credentials but my policy setup seems correct. Has anyone seen this before?

 

Appreciate any help on this.
